word_mean: 通过加热和(或)加压，使工件达到原子结合且不可拆卸连接的一种加工方法。包括熔焊、压焊、钎焊等。
利用连接件之间的金属分子在高温下互相渗透而结合成整体的一种金属结构构件连接方法。

sentence.Network_en: All the welding had been done from inside the car.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有的焊接都在车内完成。

sentence.Network_en: The welding is so smooth that you can hardly see where the sections of pipe are joined together.
sentence.Network_cn: 这管子焊接得很光滑,你很难看出什么地方是焊接的.

sentence.Network_en: The welding conditions should always be neutral or slightly oxidizing.
sentence.Network_cn: 焊接气氛必须永远保持中性或微氧化.

熔接性，焊接性，锻接性 weldability熔接，焊接，锻接 welding熔接条，焊条，电焊条 welding rod
③另外在加工中,部分切屑粘结(adhesion)、熔结(welding)在刀刃附近。一般的粘结、熔结磨损是零件,非烧结刀具损伤原因之一,对烧结工具材料来讲有可能产生粘结、熔结.

entry.def: To weld one piece of metal to another means to join them by heating the edges and putting them together so that they cool and harden into one piece.

example.ex: It's possible to weld stainless steel to ordinary steel...
example.tran: 不锈钢是有可能和普通钢焊接在一起的。

example.ex: They will also be used on factory floors to weld things together...
example.tran: 它们也可用于工厂车间，用来焊接物体。

entry.def: A weld is a join where two pieces of metal have been welded together.
If you weld people together, you join them together to form a united organization.

example.ex: She has both the authority and the personality to weld the party together...
example.tran: 团结全党所需的权威和个人魅力她两者兼具。

example.ex: The miracle was that Rose had welded them into a team.
example.tran: 令人称叹的是罗斯把他们打造成了一个团队。

means.word_mean: 1. fastening two pieces of metal together by softening with heat and applying pressure
